description: From Middle English misseien, misseyen, misseggen, equivalent to mis- +‎ say. Cognate with Middle Dutch misseggen (“to missay”).

verbs.description: missay (third-person singular simple present missays, present participle missaying, simple past and past participle missaid)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, intransitive) To say something erroneous; to speak wrongly.
